intro: Bertolonia kollmannii, commonly known as the Kollmann's bertolonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
